intro: Eriogonum meledonum, commonly known as the meadow flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Eriogonum meledonum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native environment.
